definition: to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
to herd/to breed livestock/to govern (old)/government official (old)

sentences.english: they grazed their cattle over thousands of acres of public domain.
sentences.chinese: 他们在几千英亩的公共区域放牧。

sentences.english: Over-grazing has damaged the vegetation cover of this area, and the land is beginning to show signs of desertification.
sentences.chinese: 过度的放牧使该地区被覆遭到破坏，土地开始荒漠化。

sentences.english: Overgrazing is the major cause of desertification worldwide.
sentences.chinese: 过度放牧是主要的原因，全球防治荒漠化。

sentences.english: The winds of the Great Plains caused huge dust storms on overgrazed lands.
sentences.chinese: 大平原上的大片草原由于过分放牧而逐渐荒芜。

sentences.english: Some cattle were grazing off in the distance in spots where the grass was tall and luscious.
sentences.chinese: 一些牛放牧过，在距景点如草，身材性感。

sentences.english: The influence of pasturing on the vegetation was also analyzed and is discussed.
sentences.chinese: 同时就过度放牧对植被的影响进行了论述。
这是由于过度放牧造成的。

sentences.english: You should graze your flock on this side.
sentences.chinese: 你应放牧你的羊群到河的这岸。

sentences.english: The key is how grazing animals are managed.
sentences.chinese: 这一问题的关键在与如何看待放牧管理。

sentences.english: Farmers may want to put up electric fences to inclose enclose grazing areas, called productspaddocks.
sentences.chinese: 牧民可能想要电篱笆以围住放牧区，这叫围场。

sentences.english: And 160 reindeer herders have already been evicted from their pastures.
sentences.chinese: 160个放牧驯鹿的牧民已经被赶出自己的牧场。

sentences.english: I shall graze the bottom field.
The ones who are are some cows grazing among piles of garbage.
sentences.chinese: 这里只有一些在成堆的垃圾之中放牧的奶牛。

sentences.english: Our sheep are summered in high pastures every year.
sentences.chinese: 我们每年在高地牧场给我们的羊群作夏季放牧。

sentences.english: Dairy farming produces milk, butter and cheese from cows that graze in grassy fields.
sentences.chinese: 乳品业靠在牧场放牧的奶牛生产牛奶，黄油和奶酪。

sentences.english: However, more cattle per acre is just one benefit.
sentences.chinese: 然而，每英亩放牧牧畜数的增加只是单面的受益。

definition: to tend a flock of sheep/to let sheep out to pasture/fig. to throw off the reins/to leave sb alone/acting freely and irresponsibly
nomadic/to move about in search of pasture/to rove around as a nomad
